Question: Unlike Sigmund Freud, this person thought spiritual experience was essential to our well-being.
Hints: In an interview with Carol Baumann in 1948, this person denied rumors regarding any sympathy for the Nazi movement, saying:.
This person's primary disagreement with Freud stemmed from their differing concepts of the unconscious.
This person died on 6 June 1961 at Küsnacht, after a short illness.
